Description: Textile fragment of cloth; wide fragment from one end of linen cloth of medium to fine quality; short looped warp fringe across the end; undecorated and now an uneven tan colour, possibly due to a iron/tannin wash(?). The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.40 ends per 10mm and weft 18 picks per 10mm. Worn.
Curator's comments: Includes a typical Middle Kingdom fringe, hence dating. The way that the side is pulled in along by the missing selvedge suggests that this was the end of the tubluar warp where the weaving began. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
